mQTPUNWtgHwec6EcA3n6UQ.text: Excellent.  I have dined here for both lunch and dinner many times.  Every time the food and the service was superb.  Drinks are reasonably priced and solid.  Ginger the bartender is very polite and does a great job.  The ribs are very good and the Paulie sandwich will fill you up.  This is a great place.

CjSCFmwmbT_kbj5Pn6A8eg.text: We love the Tega Cay location. We had been to the Rock Hill one once but it was so cramped that we hadn't returned despite loving the food. The Tega Cay location is closer to us and much more spacious. The pig wings are good and the pork belly is to die for! We also had them cater a large event and they were amazing! I received a large portion of pulled pork in the restaurant and was even able to take some home. The service, bartender and food were all really good in the restaurant and for the catered event.

GLh7fmdKM1Fyymqec_7wag.text: I was conflicted about how many stars to give *this location*. I LOVE Dixie Pig barbecue. Both the Rock Hill location and this one have my favorite barbecue anywhere. BUT: This location is so... SO... loud. I went once shortly after it opened and although there were very few people in the restaurant, I could barely have a conversation with my fiance. They had music turned up SUPER loud and the acoustics combined with the obnoxious music just made it a less than enjoyable experience. I was excited that this location has so much more space but I cannot sit in this restaurant. I will be going back... but half of the experience for me is going *out*, sitting in a restaurant to get out of the house. So I will be getting takeout. I want to see if they make any attempts to keep the music down low consistently and get some panels or something to bring that awful noise level down. I will update this review if they do.

ZV0j5rZYl4E6Hp86xUyrvQ.text: The evening our family visited Dixie Pig in Tega Cay it was extremely hot.  I don't know if the AC was broken but I do not appreciate eating indoors and sweating while trying to enjoy my meal.  I had the French Dip and it was not as good as the Dixie Pig in Rock Hill.  The meat was tougher, I will visit in Rock Hill but not Tega Cay again.

245t8isB9C4yejUS2BChhA.text: They are working really hard. Food is good and creative so not just a plain BBQ joint. Still need a little refinement in service but the staff and Manager are attentive and will make it good for you. Will be back

tBCC97b2rGCyatlk0Lat4w.text: We come here often!  Food is always excellent but tonight the ribs were totally beyond delish!  My hubs was very happy to get his Father's Day fix!  Kudos to the Pig for the awesome bbq!  And a shout out to the bartender Dex, who always give us great service and makes us feel like family!

VeSKk2ox_6iLo1ztj5aZAg.text: Everything made in-house. The pulled chicken salad was great. Their homemade onion dressing was the bomb. The Memphis Sauce was fantastic!!!

-rYFNF6Pbvx_uNxJhUQZ6w.text: Came for lunch today with 2 co-workers.  This was my 5th visit.  The pulled pork sandwich was fantastic.  Mac and cheese was really good as well!!!  The bud light draft was cold and served promptly.  I will always come back to this place for lunch or happy hour.  The black hair female bartender was SLAMMED!!!  But...she kept her cool and did a fantastic job.  She did not let the pressure get to her.  Thanks for another great visit Dixie Pig.

0gfPOO2ODOpb_Xxh3DteEw.text: The best barbeque around.  When you walk into the place you can tell they are going to have good barbeque just from looking in the dining room.  The food would not disappoint you

rOUlO0Nw0Asjl-J3IAN_Lg.text: Food was amazing and service was great.   We will go back again and save room for dessert!

FoIMQVLafKx8IU_8xe6V-Q.text: It is great to have Dixie Pig as an alternative to all of the fast food in Fort Mill and Tega Cay.  We have ordered take out several times, and their barbecue is outstanding.  We plan to go have a sit down meal soon, and enjoy some cocktails at the bar and watch sports.  It's a very friendly home-town environment.

gLRYjbS4XqAbEXOoUinMow.text: Everything was fantastic! I highly recommend the shrimp app. The wings were spectacular as well. Needless to say BBQ was off the hook. The staff was beyond awesome and loved the patio. All around excellent! Great experience!

3_KVeOSevdQarnVT_r1z8g.text: Looking for some good BBQ  or other awesome yumminess! Go to The Dixie Pig  in Rock Hill or Tega Cay! The one is RH is small, but the food is amazing. Tega Cay location is large with a full size bar. Help local business thrive!! After ordering many times from RH, went to TC location last night and the servers are great and the manager came out of the kitchen to check on every table! Service with a smile! The 1/4 chicken white with Alabama White sauce and the BBQ hash are amazing! I've never had anything that was fabulous! Mac and Cheese is just like from grandma's kitchen.

GPoQmXcfuvykypM-Z9HPOg.text: Dixie Pig is legit. I heard great things about the Rock Hill location and was super excited they were coming to Tega Cay. Despite the typical grand opening pains (e.g. service, food delays etc) the Dixie Pig is top on my list for great barbecue and I've tried the "best of" St. Louis, Kansans City and the Carolinas. Welcome Dixie Pig!

RpB_XfXWgWHF7S7Ou2JsSw.text: Dixie Pig in Rock Hill is my go to place for ribs. Today I tried Tega Cay and was very disappointed. The sides were as expected but the ribs portion was small and tough. The beer was over priced. The restaurant was clean and nice.

ZxrQIkIcmYDYVIULXKV5Fg.text: Great location, comfortable dining room and bar. Food is outstanding and service fantastic. Had reservations this past Saturday for 10 at 1pm, ended up having more than expected, 22 people to be exact and they accommodated us with no hesitation. Items I have tried so far are pork belly, hash, shrimp, bbq ribs and pulled pork. All fantastic including  sides.  Nice bar area with tons of beer options and mixed drinks. Great family atmosphere in dining room. They also have an outdoor bar and patio with tons of seating during warm weather.

s0Apl2_sLEdA0o252S5EZg.text: Found Dixie Pig on Yelp. So glad we did. Wife and I shared pig wings, prime rib sandwich, pork belly, Mac n cheese and fries with the sandwich. Everything was so good we want to go back now.

_bMVZ8d2dt3dbFPaKzDd8g.text: I finally made it on a Wednesday for the Brisket.   I took a bite and thought, that's pretty good.  Then I took another bite.  And then another bite.  By the time I finished I was rendered speechless and I was as satisfied as any man can be by great barbecue.

XyhENpuR7Tp5z6QFnKFjjQ.text: Finally decided to try the newest bbq spot in Tega Cay and I was more than impressed. We went for lunch and enjoyed the outside patio seating. Service was decent, but the food more than made up for any wait in service.  I will definitely be back! Great Job!

OuzRQF9qtJkLbf-j4OpD8w.text: Best BBQ in the state! I'm from the NC mountains and know good BBQ. This place is an award winner for its sauces! BTW, their hush puppies, !

1ooBz8xVPfM3oQI2kk2u9g.text: So the food is good. I can't complain although maybe update the menu once in a while?? The restaurant is kind of dirty and run down.  They have a really cute outside area and if they managed it better they could have even more business.

fp1eFMc6XvSeC0BbXqLaAg.text: Good food and good service.  This is a nice addition to Tega Cay and I like the proximity of it to my house.  Beer selection was also good which will make it a good place come the fall for football.

Wui49KO0N2fMNuCOEtJQrA.text: Fantastic BBQ, with terrible service with a smile. Stopped in with my wife and two kids and enjoyed everything about the place. Just wish the waitress wasn't so busy. Order a half rack of ribs and asked for a side of sauce, it didn't arrive until I received the bill. My wife asked for a D. Pepsi and it never came. The waitress forgot the kids drinks too until we asked twice. It may be a good idea if she wasn't responsible for tables inside and outside... she made it seems like we weren't as important as her customers sitting inside.

4mZJnONdxZBvUhDl4nL9NQ.text: I love the house BBQ sauce. Also the Mac & Cheese was verrrry good. We finished the meal with the two desserts, the Banana Pudding and the Raspberry glazed cheesecake topped doughnut. Both were amazing!

Y_8qUoLyCHFUa2pc3MVSoQ.text: I was skeptical at first, having read some of the reviews, only to find out the food and the service were excellent! Our server Erin was prompt and pleasant, and the food itself was delicious. We started out with the pork belly appetizer and went on to the St. Louis style barbecue ribs and bratwurst dinner, both of which were fantastic! The smoked BBQ flavor came through and was moist and flavorful...As so many BBQ joints are not, where the meat is dry and chewy. We loved it! Which is a most needed eatery in Tega Cay. Welcome

JKnyG1SrdXVFWmYOR0mBuQ.text: Fantastic pulled pork and vinegar based house BBQ sauce. Fried bologna was delicious as well. Service was friendly and efficient. Beers might be a buck higher than other places but food prices and portions make up for it. Definitely worth the trip.

qbsvxPkxo75hCX8K0gc53w.text: I have been to the Dixie Pig on Celanese several times, but since it was Friday night us and our friends went to this new location.  When we pulled up we looked at each other and said wow they are packed, but seeing as how this location is much larger we decided to see if we could get a seat.  Thy had a table for 6 ready, but unfortunately it was inside where they had a band playing.  My daughter had a bad headache and we asked for an outside table, at first they they thought it would be a 30 min wait, but to our surprise they were able to get us a table in a couple of minutes.  Our waiter David was incredible and was awesome getting our orders quickly and our drinks.  I highly recommend the onion dip and the jalapeno pimento cheese (this comes with fried pork skins which were still sizzling when it came out) Wow.  We ordered the French dip sandwich, ribs, the Paulie, pulled pork, and the smoked chicken!  All the dishes were perfect and delicious!Considering how packed the place was I thought our food came out quickly and there was no rush for us to hurry.  I can't thank the management for getting us a table quickly or him checking to make sure we were ok.  Yes I saw you making sure we were in good hands and I can't thank you enough for your thoughtfulness!  I can't wait for more family and friends to visit so we can bring them here!  Great new place, great staff, you folks rock!

F29vcSEok1vt7Byplez3xQ.text: Had the pulled pork sandwich with Mac n cheese and fries. Awesome. Tried the mustard and house vinegar sauces, both delicious. Will be back soon.

T5VJLzTZS0Mv8VMxZQlQOg.text: 4 stars because it is NOISEY. Our server Ashlie was great and fun!  Love a sense of humor.  Had the brats which were really good with the special mustard sauce. Delicious! Met the owner Paul. My husband (not a big bbq fan) had grilled bologna and cheese. Says it was good but will try something else when we go back. Smoked chicken soundsdelicious.  Try it out.

MV7kgpWjFEFhBqDB_T61dw.text: Food is good but the inside of the place not good . Dull and towards the back looks like a cafeteria . Guy bartender there is annoying and made me want to leave .  I'll get the food to go if I go back .

q3D8K-XwRQilTq-tHl4JpA.text: So glad they are finally open.  No surprise that the food is just as good as what made them as desired as they are.  The server did an amazing job, the portions are spot on.  Being one who doesn't like smoked chicken I can say they have some kind of awesomeness twist the do to theirs, I almost think maybe the smoke it then grill it or something, no matter what they do the chicken is amazing.  The biggest drawback with this location, and this has been an issue with every restaurant in this same spot, the draft beer isn't cold enough, the make shift cooler is nothing more than a room with some window air conditioners, I don't know anyone who wants to spend $6-$8 on a great craft beer and have it come out just a bit cooler than room temp.  This in itself won't stop me from going back but it will impact how often I do go back.

4ZEZQn1MjoEKWt45RGsFlQ.text: In Tega Cay for the weekend and went twice because the smoked chicken is amazing. Their sauces are good but the chicken doesn't need any sauce. Yep, that good. Great beer selection too.

OeDQdYripA9RUZyUh6FX9w.text: Meh.  Had high hopes for this place but after two visits with very inattentive wait staff, I don't see it lasting too long.  First time my daughter and I went for an after school snack. It took over 20 minutes for anyone to take our drink order.  Second time was this week for dinner and we waited nearly an hour for our food before giving up and leaving.   Really hope they can work the kinks out because the food is really good. I think the large space and many tables may be their PITfall

-KLe41UYZxwgql3W11Wd3A.text: Awesome hole in the wall restaurant. Authentic bbq!! Great selection of house made sauce. Food is cooked daily. Family friendly, laid back atmosphere.  Black eyed peas + collards are amazing! Also the Mac n cheese is great. The bbq chicken sandwich was great too! Decent sized portions. A good place to pick up dinner to take home.

yjJGXHvMNvFU1Jzrp-rt-Q.text: THEME RESTAURANT: This is a tale of two BBQ joints in one Day: Gary's BBQ for lunch (adjacent review if you click my name or picture) in China Grove NC, and Dixie Pig in Tega Cay, just over the border in SC for dinner (this review). First off, Dixie Pig is NOT a real BBQ joint: It's a theme restaurant masquerading as a BBQ joint, much like Olive Garden masquerading with an Italian theme. They serve only a partial menu of BBQ, missing such standbys as burnt ends, beef ribs, pulled chicken platters, or brisket sandwich... And brisket on Wednesdays ONLY! The dining room is Dark and Very Noisy, though there was enough light over our table to read the menu, and it was clean. Our waitress wasn't very friendly, she spoke fast and I couldn't understand her, even after telling her I'm hearing impaired three times, even though I pointed to my bright, big hearing aids. I had the pulled pork platter with mac & cheese side. The pulled pork was dry & crunchy, which means it was WAY overcooked; and the mac & cheese was bland. There were only four BBQ sauces: * House, which was bland and not very savory. * Alabama white, which was just buttermilk, mayo, and vinegar -- Bland, runny, and hardly authentic (but surprised they even knew about it); * SC mustard; * NC vinegar I'm giving this restaurant two stars, only because it looked clean; and the menu had some interesting items not expected at a BBQ restaurant. Otherwise, Find Another Restaurant if you like BBQ My reviews of other BBQ joints: * My review of Gary's BBQ yelp.com/biz_share/_f4rP... * My review of Whole Hog Cafe: yelp.com/biz_share/U4ALy... * My review of Smokey Barque near Chicago: yelp.com/biz_share/4oP8B...

-kiBwt7lssFHj33xFzRcXQ.text: I've eaten here, somewhere around 5-6 times and have loved it every time.  Great food, fun atmosphere and awesome service.  The ribs are phenomenal.  Try the Paulie if you're in need of a food coma. Seriously that was one of the most amazing sandwiches I've ever eaten.

IXuoCDe8G9zE2fH2EjjPzw.text: The drinks were strong and the salad was fantastic!  Not easy to find if you're not local, sits back off of the road.

--CVP4XTW1v7JpBFrVVAnA.text: Here's a great bbq joint! We had the BBQ Sunday. It's basically, bbq, baked beans, & I substituted Mac & cheese for the potato salad. It was very very good. My wife got the Paulie Sandwich with fries. Very good as well. The fries were very good and the service was your typical down home "hey ya'll" you would expect. This spot need to be on Diner, Drive-in's, & Dives. Love the atmosphere! I'll be back.

B8q5AepJQxyB1dv2S4SRZA.text: Excellent food, good prices.  Could use a cozier atmosphere, but all in all a great restaurant.

DON8hZtc2LVusBaeYwpjUQ.text: I have been living in Tega Cay since 2011. I have seen this location switch owners 4 times. I feel that this one will definitely stick. Very good and inexpensive bbq, quick service, and a great outside area for when the weather gets better. Love this addition to Tega Cay! (I recommend trying that BBQ Hash, either as a side or an entree)

vrtO61D1zBgArghVFhFQAg.text: This place should be called the Dixie Chicken. I only say that because I am obsessed the 1/2 chicken plate. It's probably the most under rated thing on the menu and it's delicious. Great seasoning. Never mind that the ribs are amazing. Oh and the banana pudding. Shut the front door.

nN_8CqMIRwlRnlGCzhuvEg.text: Finally a GREAT restaurant in Tega Cay. Everything I've tried is great.... but the French dip is out of this world. Friendly and helpful staff. This is my go to place...

BjBPnP60bPTpToMjifTWRw.text: Nice crowd for a Sunday night .  Service was great, fast and friendly.  Beef ribs were fantastic ... huge portion and delicious.  Fall off the bone tender and a savory hint of sweet barbecue sauce that was awesome in its own right but subtle enough to let the flavor of the meat shine through... and man did it ever!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

FkvkS2Wzlf5Cj3N_oxruyQ.text: I am a Yankee so Carolina BBQ is really not my thing. BUT THE BURGERS - OMG, they are the best! Will never go anywhere else for a burger and fries. The Burgers are 1/3 pound of juicy goodness and the fries are well-seasoned and the perfect compliment. Other tasty sides are the Mac and cheese and the fried corn. If they are serving it, definitely get the Peach Dumpling with Vanilla Ice Cream. Definitely a winner restaurant or take out place!

tWKpjYUSqEfgGOQ_3pjcRw.text: Best waitress ever Ashley ! We had great food loved the mustard bbq sauce is a must try. We will b regulars

pWg8XuYFjbJti4frzTIVjw.text: We ate here for the first time this evening. The food and service were both excellent. The grilled pork belly with Asian BBQ glaze was delicious. The BBQ prime rib sandwich was also very good. We'll definitely be back to visit soon!

QmKbNDJdrcx6tV9jhl9rAQ.text: Love love love this place. It is our go to spot! We have been going to the one in Rock Hill for a few years so was super happy to see the one open in our neighborhood. Give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

M35zs68wJs48KuPjGP-oRw.text: Yum! I have been a fan of the pig since I moved here. Started at the location in rock hill. I bring all of my out of town company here and they love it! The Tega Cay Location seems to have a more extensive menu. You can never go wrong with the pulled pork. Check it out!

PczQ0EN9gRCBneAgS5yRng.text: The food is wonderful. The staff is very nice and observant. Be sure to try the Mac n Cheese.

bWtgl3BWRTadXImW19-0QQ.text: This review is based on two visits.  We first visited just a few days after opening and the experience was great.  Service was fast and attentive and the food came out quick and was worth coming back for.  I did note that they seemed overstaffed at the time and all the owners were  present and greeting guests. 5 star experience in this day.  Unfortunately our second visit could not have gone worse.  We waited at the host stand for nearly 5 mins while the hostess stayed on the phone taking to/go orders.  No other staff walking by took the initiative to greet us so we just had to wait.  When we were sat, our waitress again took over 5 mins to come to the table.  Drink order was placed and they arrived after a short wait, we put in our food order at 615pm.   I was telling my wife and our hungry 6yr old 'don't worry bbq places serve fast because most of it is already made and just needs to be plated up.' After 20 mins of waiting I was starting to get worried,  that's when I noticed other tables in the place didn't have food either.  I stated watching the kitchen door to see if anything was coming out- no food,  just some flustered looking waitresses.   By 640 we were ready to give up.  It took until 645 to find out waitress and officially throw in the towel.   No visit or acknowledgement by management, an apology was offered by the waitress on our way out the door. I felt sorry for the hungry masses that were just entering the place- good luck. This little piggy went home. 0 Star experience this day  Seems the luster has worn off and the owners have gone back to rock hill.  This is too big of a restaurant space to be successful without solid systems and procedures in place. It's hard to run such a big dining room and bar,  and they haven't even used the patio yet.  This is why other private concepts have not done well here.  Without help this place has little chance.  I am hoping they get it figured out before it succumbs to the fate of the previous.

q8VOmGVuXNuJakjOhfzrMw.text: Loved loved loved !! Chelsea was great with the menu suggestions. The best BBQ we have ever had. Our meals were piping hot and so tasty !!! We will be back again and again. Oh did I mention how much we loved "The Dixie Pig " I think I did. Enjoy

BBITpVAC7Jokp270bH0PdQ.text: Worst experience I have had at any restaurant. The bartender was terrible. She took our order and could not figure out how to order a grill cheese with bacon and tomato.  It came out as a BLT with a piece of cheese.  The other sandwich was a French dip.  Which I actually ordered a pork sandwich.  10 minutes later as I am eating it they brought out out pork sandwich.  The bartender told me items come out at different times for the group we were with.  I said I was just eating what they brought me.  She did not offer to get that sandwich for the person that I was eating.  I ended up paying for an extra sandwich for him.  She also could not get drink orders out timely I waited 15 minutes between trying to get refills on beers.  This service from her was terrible as she blamed me for all of it.

IjsAcictViLmuof9F5E7Gg.text: I go here for lunch about once a month and get the Big bowl salad with smoked shrimp. So tasty and the servers are always really nice about me wanting to sit on the patio with my dog.

i987AZUcgh3Be5oAFBJ9OQ.text: Driving in, the sign is a few yards closer to HWY 160 than the driveway to pull in. You might put your blinker on a bit too soon but, never hurts to warn people! I met 3 friends around 7p on a Tuesday night. It was packed outside on the deck, which want surprising considering the beautiful 70 degree night. The whole place was seat yourself and I counted 6 waiter/waitresses. I'd say it was staffed just right for the evening. We chose to sit at the bar area tables (high tops) and quite enjoyed Dax, our bartender/server. He was a nice, shoot it straight kind of guy.  We all ordered beverages and started out by sharing the french onion dip. The pita chips were fresh, flavorful, warm and served with a killer dip. The onion flavor wasn't too overpowering (Didn't linger all night) and the tang from the cream cheese seemed to pair perfectly.  Three of the four of us ordered the BBQ Plate with two sides. Two of us had the fries and mac n cheese, one had fries and baked beans. Two enjoyed the Memphis Magic sauce and the other devoured his Carolina Gold. The fourth in our party had the 1/2 chicken with potato salad and baked beans. He ordered the Alabama White sauce and practically licked the plate clean of it. Everything came out hot, delicious and perfectly seasoned. The meat was moist and tender, sides were fresh; really great spot!  All four entrees were proportioned perfectly and priced as expected for quality and quantity. Really can't complain! Plenty of floor space for a group or just a casual date.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Plates, Salads and Sides
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pulled Pork plate, Memphis Magic sauce, seasoned fries, mac n&#39; cheese and hushpuppies
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Brews

Z-tfgOLDQtpkoQkrX6agnA.text: The ambiance leaves something to be desired. The food was average bbq, it just can't contend with my favorite bbq place in Tega Cay. It's worth checking out once if you haven't been there, friends are either in love with it or find it average like we did.

h0zvaxyPjzL63b8AhDC4Vw.text: I tried the BBQ chicken dinner to go and it was great. The servers were attentive and the owner came out to check that "All was well" with my order. Sometime in the near future I hope to return and eat in.

NB73HYujVx1LHcCOOOQIRw.text: Good food. Good service. I tried one of their local brews that I'd highly recommend "Legal Remedy, Blonde mocha stout" yes a blonde dark tasting beer that was oh so good! Very different, but really good!   I had the Cajun shrimp appetizer it wasn't super spicy, it was good but I'd definitely try something else next time just because I think their menu won't have anything bad. The brisket sandwich was delicious, it's only offered on Thursday's if they have leftover brisket so I figured I had to try it while in town. I had it with cole slaw and the amazing  fried corn on the Cobb, and the black Betty for dessert- a great concept but not well executed.   I liked the smaller menu you could tell everything was fresh and it all was really very good. Only thing I'd say anything bad about was the dessert, it just wasn't what I expected and wasn't very "fresh" like everything else was.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

hiF7ZEPt-MSU-PkrnrEeXQ.text: Good food, reasonably priced, great atmosphere, lots to do outside for kids. So you can eat in peace!

IFuY5Xk11tZ7BTA1HrkDmA.text: The Dixie Pig has hit one of my list of favorite sandwiches in the Charlotte area's The Sandwich I am talking about is the Prime Rib French Dip! Unbelievable flavor and overall awesome sandwich!

oRlOuv5BYJhcNatqDBI0TA.text: Hands down the best BBQ place I have ever been to! My father & I visited on a Sunday afternoon, we were seated right away. Our server, Brenda, was very sweet & made great recommendations. I got the BBQ pork plate & it was the best pulled pork I've ever had. The mac n cheese is also a must have. I'd recommend this place to anyone! Definitely will be back!

5YQf_Ef4f6WWsh9lK7YCvw.text: We've been here 4 times now and have never been impressed. Restaurant is dirty, silverware on floor, sticky menus, sticky spots on tables and window sills. Last night we walked in and weren't even greeted. Took almost 10 minutes for waitress to come to our table, although she was friendly. Wings were soggy on the outside and dry and a chewy on the inside. Fried corn on the cob was gross too (and I LOVE corn). Frozen corn cob just sitting in oil. The mac & cheese was also gross, Plain, over cooked, flavorless noodles with clumps of greasy cheese. No sauce at all. When I had the French dip it was bathed in grease as well. I really want to like this place because it's close and they offer coupons, but the food just isn't good in my opinion. Good beer selection though.

LSvbKEn07VmheYlhr8i6EQ.text: The Dixie Pig is normally one of my favorite restaurants, but they were off their game today big time!  I ordered a pulled pork plate and the pork was "mushy". A very strange texture and watery. The Alabama white BBQ sauce was also a watery mess, definitely not the thicker creamy goodness I'm used to.  We then ordered two banana puddings to go, only to get home and find the containers half full and looking like it might have been left over from yesterday.  The vanilla wafers we're completely soggy and bananas  very dark Normally they have the best banana pudding I've ever had at a restaurant, and almost as good as my grandmother's use to be (which is saying a lot).  Everybody can have a bad day. Maybe their chef was out sick, who knows, but after so many wonderful experiences, I was truly disappointed today.  I hope they haven't made a change that reduces the quality permanently.

0JgpexX6-wLgC5iSr0wiuA.text: Great food. Huge bar with good tap selection along with one outside bar and stage during the warmer months. Highly recommend this place!

18nw-nZYHaHhVR0cLWESqA.text: I went here on a Wednesday night so it was the night they have beef brisket. I had the brisket, coleslaw and mac and cheese. The brisket was very good as was the mac and cheese. The coleslaw...not my type. It was mediocre at best. Also, they gave two free hush puppies that were very good even though they were not warm. Service was also very good. I would return.

bNT7Ss8O6ajcMpNzsBWfxQ.text: Beef ribs, beans, potato salad, cabbage, corn were all delicious!  Banana pudding was amazing.    Service was a bit slow, otherwise I would have rated 5 stars.

R3XbR5m_J-LhcryM-NqJhw.text: The food is generally good, but service has been sketchy recently at best. We just left after waiting 15 minutes and not one server ever came to take our order, not even drinks. There were about a dozen people in the bar but that was it. Posted hours said it was open. As we left, we indicated the issue to be told "I don't know. I just got here." Lost time on our part. List revenue for Dixie Pig as we are heading elsewhere.

4BYEXYQmLs-9hz2TEeQT5g.text: Best BBQ we've had in the local area for sure! Brisket sandwich was very good (and I'm from Texas, so I'm a brisket snob for sure) and the ribs were perfect. Great flavor, very tender, crisp but still moist and they were just shy of "fall off the bone" so you could actually take a bite of them.  The collards with black-eyed peas were OUTSTANDING! Baked beans-very good, too.  My wife and I shared the banana pudding, again, OUTSTANDING!   Sorry we didn't take pics.   Service was prompt and very friendly.  Honestly, my only complaint is that they only serve brisket once a week, otherwise they'd be very close to 5-Stars.  We will be back often!

XRloOdU4W4D0UOo5wfc58g.text: Barbecue doesn't get any better than this! The atmosphere is very relaxed and chill. The food is amazing and the pricing is fair. The server/bartender was very nice and helpful. I recommend the St. Louis style ribs and the barbecue hash. Definitely a hidden gem!

0gQ796niZSq176Vy_Nbjkw.text: Food:  Honestly the best BBQ i have had from local joints. Had the pulled pork plate, fries and white slaw. My friend had the same but mac & cheese so we could share/try it. The Memphis sauce was really good. They have eastern NC, mustard and white sauces. All were good.   Service:  Dan was very helpful and attentive. We were served pretty quickly. But keep in mind everything is homemade so during busy times service may be a bit slower. But is not a fast food joint. We went early on a Tuesday.   Overall i would recommend to my friends and we will go back

7qBQk_Sx1f0nYUZJh26iJQ.text: We went there on a Thursday evening and it was pretty dead but the food was excellent. I had ribs with baked beans and collards, and pecan pie. All were outstanding. I highly recommend this place for anyone in the area who likes real barbecue. Enjoy!

7WrhFDd8oqAmfQb2J_Vq2g.text: Was really looking forward to trying the Dixie Pig, we much prefer mom and pops over chains.  The good: the sides were very good (homemade mac & cheese, BBQ hash) and the 1/2 rack of ribs was a large portion and tender.  The not so good: my wifes pulled pork was very fatty.  Was also disappointed to learn that Brisket is only available on Wednesdays.     With so many BBQ options in the area I doubt we'll be returning.

DywbC91MiSti2U7zThIV-w.text: I am excited to see a new option in TegaCay. We have tried this place twice So here is the good. The food is outstanding and the waitstaff is very friendly. We have had the bbq,pork belly and catfish. The bbq is very flavorful and hit the spot. Both times we were quick to get our drinks and place our order. On both visits it took over 46 mins to receive our food from time of order and several other tables endured the long wait also. I will give the benefit of doubt that it's a new establishment and they are working on the kitchen efficiencies

mQOm4yvQ2tiEPbryL10AoA.text: Everything was delicious! Excellent wings! Great french fries! A multitude of menu options that I look forward to! Pleasant and hospitable atmosphere. We will continue to frequent The Dixie Pig-without a doubt!!

QS88s7fmKGgk5PKSJXNkNA.text: When it's hopping I bet this place is a blast.  I mean this location is all set up for blues, brew, and BBQ.  However, we visited on a sleepy Saturday for lunch.   Without a crowd it's hard not to notice the hard life on this dive without its makeup on.  Pretty grungy IMO.  Service was casual and laid back (code for summer help that's working for gas money), but it worked for what we wanted.  My Big BLT delivered on flavor and the mac-n-cheese was more cheese than mac.  I liked it but I can understand if others would prefer a more balanced dish.  Cheesy.  Mmmm.  On this side of town, you might give it a whirl.  The one in Fort Mill, however, is worth the drive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Big BLT which is pork belly v. bacon, $8

JgQxrjJAqHGzM7YhHPo1xw.text: In effort to knock out another restaurant on the Yelp Top 100 from 2018 I choose to go to the Dixie Pig for a quick lunch. This did not happen.   Since moving to Steele creek I thought it would be easy to breeze in for lunch and out. I had a time restraint but still thought it was possible. However when I got there the restaurant was about half filled and there was only 1 waitress for the whole place. She announced it as another group walked in the door.   Needless to say we hadn't placed an order yet and didn't see our quick lunch being quick so we got up and left.   I really want to give them a try but this location was struggling today.   Dixie Pig -Tega Cay 2150 Gold Hill Rd Fort Mill, SC 29708 Friday April 12, 2019

u8epYnvErUi25R4mtrp8dA.text: The newness of this location has died down so it's a much more enjoyable experience now. It's actually become a go to place to take friends and meet up with my in-laws.   My go to meal is a 1/4 chicken with Alabama white sauce, black-eyed peas/collards and some type of other vegetable. I rotate between the white coleslaw, fried corn and braised cabbage. If I'm treating myself, I get the Mac and cheese. They have the best Mac. The black-eyed peas and collards are a must. They are savory, spicy and just enough vinegar. And the chicken is always tender and juicy. I would argue it's the best thing on the menu.   Service can be hit or miss. There's a man that works during lunch time that is really great. I wish I caught his name, but he's quick, friendly and always takes care of us. One weekday we came in and our server was also working the bar area. I saw other servers but they were also hanging around the bar. It was just hard to get their attention since the bar is in a different area and they were chit-chatting. So it's either been great or not so great.   Overall great barbeque!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The Usual
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

-UEiFuCCvvZXuFJy4N2tdg.text: Loving their "new" location. Wide range of beers from standard staples to local craft brews. We ordered their Dixie burger with fries and a side of mac n cheese.  Entry and parking nicely paved for those old timers who recall the gravel/potholes.  Food was good. We ordered the burger medium rare and it came out perfect; however it was a bit salty. Fries decent and mac n cheese tasty.  We like how this place has transformed and believe this place has figured it out and is an excellent fit to the community. Kudos

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. BBQ Pork plate with Alabama white sauce, fries and red slaw
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Open Face Corned Beef sandwich with mac and cheese side

-wszSceup8trFUQkkhpnDQ.text: Very nice place. The mac and cheese is very good. Baked beans and chicken is very good. This is a place you want to.visit if you want BBQ. I got the house sauce. It is a little spicy so have your water. They also have a full bar and an outside patio. I look forward to coming back when they have music

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Omg! This mac and cheese is amazing
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

9bKCT8Xs4mIcOw2H6zhE7A.text: Really good local barbeque place.  Second time we've been here when visiting family in the Charlotte area.  The pork belly appetizer was the highlight of the meal for me.  Nicely grilled with a sweetish Asian peanut sauce.  We also had the pulled pork and pork hash which were nicely smoked with crunchy outside meat and tender inside mixed in.  There are a choice of sauces, I went with Dixie Gold. Its a SC style mustard-based sauce, which has a little spice to it, and very little sweetness.  I really liked it.  The red slaw was also good as a side.  It had what seemed to be a red wine vinegar base, and had a kick that paired nicely with the pork.  We also had the pork hash, with the mustard sauce, ans which is served over rice is a good take on a South Carolina specialty.  I recommend this place, its one of the best I've tried on my visits to Fort Mill

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pork hash plate
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pulled pork platter
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pork belly starter

PWVvdtIep_EJDaBD6FkGXA.text: Fantastic new restaurant from the great Dixie Pig folks in Rock Hill.  The menu here is just like the original, but what makes this place great is the wide open spaces.  While the Rock Hill location is small and has a dearth of parking, this joint has it all.  Great parking, outdoor seating, room for the whole family, and a crazy big bar.   Speaking of bar, they have tons of awesome local craft beers from both Carolinas.  That alone will make me come back for more.    As far as food.  I love their plates and sandwiches just about as much as I love their sides.  Bbq Hash, red coleslaw, a baked #macncheese, and many many more.    The service was another feather in the cap here.  Cody was awesome and knew the menu like the back of his hand.  Great front man with some amazing marking skills there.    You can't beat either Dixie Pig location, but this one is a definate goto for anybody wanting to spread out and enjoy the experience.  #Kudos #PlacesWeLove

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

9NcQYmyGwFrYLIwpDCRa3g.text: On the one hand, I wish the Dixie Pig was a bit closer, but on the other hand, I'm rather glad that they aren't because I'd be there a whole lot more frequently.   This spot is a good size on the inside, and because of that it can be a bit loud due to the echo, but the staff does a great job of communicating despite that potential issue, the only thing to be aware of is that if you happen to hit it wrong, there could be a slight delay.  Not sure exactly what happened, as things were going swimmingly, and our apps came out just about immediately after we ordered them (including some freshly-popping pork rinds), but it took a really long time for the main dishes to be delivered. It's certainly possible that some larger parties slipped in while we were eating on our apps, but whatever it is, this was about the only downside.  The meal itself was tasty and there was plenty of food to go around.

cAegeIKE2V6tlfWFDvZUsQ.text: The homemade pork rinds and jalapeno pimento cheese were incredible!  The only thing I didn't like was when we ate the last one . My husband had me try the pig wing (although it was good I think it's got a breading on it so I won't have it again #keto).  The chopped salad was amazing too... especially with the added pulled smoked chicken and yummy chunky blue cheese dressing.  They also had an amazing Carolina gold sauce, definitely highly recommended. .. Sorry for the long food post but it was worth talking about . They have a location in Rock Hill as well.  If you're in those areas out passing through I recommend trying them out. .. Also lots of keto friendly options!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. The chopped salad with pulled smoked chicken is amazing.#ketofriendly
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pig Wings.... Even better dipped in the Carolina Gold sauce
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Pork Rinds with Jalapeno Pimento Cheese... phenomenal and #ketofriendly

ORMgVLSxsPq0cQFOsj03sg.text: Family friendly with a good selection of beer on tap.  Kid's menu was good with the Mac and cheese but the meal size mac is the same as a side of Mac.  The corn is deep fried and my children would not touch it.  Overall the kids loved the pulled pork.  We had the garlic Parmesan wings and they were tasty; but, the Pork ribs were our favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Dessert
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Beer
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Kid menu

QtkZ7JIrfLYMKZ3URKzS_g.text: I don't know where to start....when you say BBQ and your menu discloses items are smoked and we may run out....i would expect my ribs to be smoked....they had grills marks on them (both sides) and zero smoke ring/taste. I got them without sauce but I thought they would at least be seasoned....nope. The bathrooms where also GROSS!!!! It was a slow Sunday afternoon...can't blame the bar customers for that. Big fail on this visit! Not sure we will be back.

qLxX6s0LO0wgUBuoL1XTzQ.text: The food is usually good. Occasionally you will get some of the bbq that is a bit dry or feels as if it has been left out too long.  The salads are huge so be prepared when you order one. Other interesting items are he pig wings and the "Paulie".   I enjoy one of the wing sauces the most...monkey habanero. Unfortunately my wife wife only likes sweet bbq sauce and the only thing that is close is their Memphis  and she doesn't enjoy it.   The Mac n cheese is always on point and the pimento cheese with pork rinds is a solid app.   The best dessert we've had was the peanut butter pie and the banana pudding. Both were very good.   The only thing keeping them from 4 stars is the wait seems long almost days to receive food and sometimes it takes so long to get refills you'd rather them just let you get your own.

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

B7hh071k3ZrhXCP2-91Hdg.text: Awesome... just like Rock Hill. My staple meal is the French Dip and it was amazing as always. This location is set back behind the salon with lots of parking which is nice. It's new and big, it can fit the crowd which is really great. They absolutely needed this location, it came at the perfect time! The bar space is great, I can't wait to spend a few happy hours there. I'm happy to see that there have a nice outdoors area that's enclosed plus an open outdoor area. This spot is perfectly placed.   I must say it was nice to see some familiar faces from Rock Hill, the owner/chef was there as well as our very first waiter we had from Rock Hill. I'm sure they were helping run everything as smooth as possible. We will definitely be back here to try the new additions to the menu. I posted some pics of the menu so everyone can see!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States

Ts3RYINqIzuLKHjhc-ym0A.text: Great barbeque and good service. Would recommend mac & cheese. Food always served very quickly.

Hq1FppAlgUKKNlumhMjOJQ.text: I really wanted to like this place and make it a go to choice in my neighborhood but unfortunately it gets worse every time I've been in there.   Stagnant beer selection, cig butts scattered all around the patio area, slow service, inconsistent food... this place needs a systems overhaul.   Outdoor bar area looks like a storage area for broken equipment. The barrel that they use for jenga has exposed nails sticking out of it.   Very weird... is anyone managing this place?

AJi9MTd-Nkhl9so-_2pHTg.text: Great pulled pork sandwiches and ribs. Very generous amount of pulled pork on each sandwich.  Potato salad was awesome.  Owner is always out walking around and ensuring everyone is pleased with their meals.  Our waiter, I believe his name was Shawn, was OUTSTANDING!

kz7TnRbzCcFbOz2AXh_N-Q.text: Garlic Parmesan wings extra crispy  AWESOME!! Owner is proud and involved.  Great chill bbq dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Dixie Pig Tega Cay - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken Wings

Q9UomTFnbWtwDAFE5jju_A.text: Been going here since it opened. We live in Tega Cay and this is by far the best BBQ I've ever had. Everytime we have family or friends in town we take them here. You get massive portions for a good price and the food is amazing. I'm from Buffalo and this is the only place I will order chicken wings from outside of home. Their white slaw is addictive and the banana pudding is life changing - get it!!! The staff is awesome too, we love them all!

QeWfLZ3xdmScg0urzj17IQ.text: Have been to the hole jn the wall in Rock Hill and like that "Dive" ambience and mentality. I understand the desire to expand as a good thing but this new location has always had an identity crisis and a full bar that has "regulars"  hanging out getting sloshed . (Thats not so new) I,m not a fan of that.  How can I help with my review? - Good job on the BBQ sandwiches and hash. Great flavor! Personally I prefer having assorted sauces available on the table as opposed  to a la carte. -Always have a plan to greet customers upon entry even if it is pre-happy hour. We weren't. -Always have exceptional restrooms as their condition can indicate an all around attitude towards cleanliness. Just saying. I Will try a few more times as 521 bbq isn,t really that impressive. Good luck!
